intro: Pentachaeta exilis var. aphantochaeta, commonly known as the slender pentachaeta, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its ecological role includes supporting local insect populations and contributing to the biodiversity of its native environment.
